intro: Pedicularis jankae, commonly known as the Janka's lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
